definition: to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
abbr. for Tianjin 天津 (also 津沽)

sentences.english: Pecsaetnastill taking bids for many of the positions? quite an auction.
sentences.chinese: 许多岗位待价而沽？这就是个拍卖会啊。

sentences.english: Walpole believed every man had his price;
sentences.chinese: 沃波尔认为每个人都是待价而沽的。

sentences.english: Half a dozen of the top clubs are for sale. No one wants to buy, though.
sentences.chinese: 半打顶级俱乐部待价而沽，但却没有买家。

definition: rare commodity worth hoarding/object for profiteering
to artificially inflate/to bid up (the price)
lit. the emperor's daughter does not worry about whether she will be able to marry (idiom)/fig. highly sought after
pinyin: huang2 di4 nu:3 er2 bu4 chou2 jia4

definition: to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to covet/to long for/to lust after
